Friday, Detober 28, 1949
Dear Girls,
This is being written en route to Bangkok from Caleutta where I
arrived at 1,00 a,m. this morning.
At the airport I leamed thet some
twenty people hed been killed in a riot neer the Great Tastern Hotel a
fer hours earlier, but that I need have no concern beesuse "the riot is
now well in hand".
It took an hour to get through Publie Heelth, Inni-
gration,
Security Officer and
Customs, I filled out forms end more forms
notwithstanding the faot that the very sane dey I was going on to Hongkong.
Finally, at about 2:30 a.m. I got away and at 3100 e.a. arrived at the
Great Eastern Hotel (only the second name of which is deserved).
I filled out four more forms, signed the hotel register twice and two cards,
the only possible purpose of which was to keep sone bureauerata in gainful
occupation.
My bed was a conorete-like slab with pillow to match, and I
couldn't get to sleep.
However, at about 5100 a.m. I did fall off only
to be awakened at 7:30 by my room boy who let himself in with a pase key
to ask 1f I wanted breakfast. I told him to come back at 10,00 a.m. but
within another half hour there was a knocking et my door.
There I found
a siter who asked the sone question.
So, I gave up and said "yes* hoping
that he would not bring it for hours, but about the time I got back to
sleep in he came.
After breakfest four sweepers come in to elemn up the
room (each subsequently wanted & tip), ao I retreated to the beth where
an uncurtained shower mansged to get some wster on me but wore on the
floor which like my bed wes renlly conerete - so it didn't matter.
Went around to the PAA new office which in very up-to-date with
air conditioning and a lovely view over the Miden or perk.
A friend
took the PAA /1 and me to lunch at the Bangel Club.
This is a stuffy old
building also on the Midan but probably one of the world's most exclusive.
To join you must be a pure blooded British eitizen who has resided con-
tinuously in India for ten or more years.
Also, you must be favorably
know by each of the twelve directors or members of the Bosrd.
It us Friday and my host explained thet before the days of the
airplane the neilboat left on Thursday.
Men sorked to get off their mail,
and that done relaxed on Friday,
The Club put on a special menu and
members tarried long in the bar before lunch and longer afterwards.
Now,
despite the change in the times the custom continues and the Club mas pacied,
or should I say
the bar,
We couldn't get a table or even standing room
so my host said,
*You know this sort of thing ian't done - relly not ever -
but I see no reason why me shouldn't have our cocktails at the luncheon
table".
That we
did,
but ve were the only ones (at 1120 p.m.) in the
